meanings.def: a word or statement saying sorry for something that has been done wrong or that causes a problem
examples: You owe him an apology for what you said.
We should like to offer our apologies for the delay to your flight today.
We received a letter of apology.
She rejected my apology, saying it was not enough.
John muttered an apology then went back to his book.
I make no apologies for bringing this issue to your attention once again.
If anyone has been offended, I extend my sincere apologies.
It was a mistake. My profuse apologies.
He backed out arrogantly and without apology.
The newspaper has issued an apology to the minister.
We expect a full written apology.

meanings.def: information that you cannot go to a meeting or must leave early
examples: The meeting started with apologies (= the names of people who said they could not go to the meeting).
(formal) She made her apologies and left early.

meanings.def: if you say that you make no apology/apologies for something, you mean that you do not feel that you have said or done anything wrong

idioms.def: if you say that you make no apology/apologies for something, you mean that you do not feel that you have said or done anything wrong
